output.name: deploymentName
output.label: OpenAI Deployment Name

generateAnImage.name: generateAnImage
generateAnImage.label: Generate an Image (DALL-E 3)

expect.help: A text description of the desired image(s).
expect.name: prompt
expect.label: Prompt

expect.help: The size of the generated images.
expect.name: size
expect.label: Size

expect.help: The quality of generated image. `HD` creates images with finer details and greater consistency across the image.
expect.name: quality
expect.label: Quality

expect.help: The format in which the generated images are returned.
expect.name: response_format
expect.label: Response Format

generateAnImage.description: Generates an image based on the prompt.

createATranslation.name: createATranslation
createATranslation.label: Create a Translation (Whisper)

expect.help: File name with its extension. Supported formats: `.flac`, `.mp3`, `.mp4`, `.mpeg`, `.mpga`, `.m4a`, `.ogg`, `.wav`, or `.webm`.
expect.name: fileName
expect.label: File Name

expect.help: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should be in English.
expect.name: prompt
expect.label: Prompt

expect.help:
Higher temperatures generate more diverse and creative responses. For example, `0.8`. Lower temperatures generate more focused and well-defined responses. For example, `0.2`.
The default value is `1`.
expect.name: temperature
expect.label: Temperature

createATranslation.description: Creates a translation of an audio to English.

createATranscription.name: createATranscription
createATranscription.label: Create a Transcription (Whisper)

expect.help: File name with its extension. Supported formats: `.flac`, `.mp3`, `.mp4`, `.mpeg`, `.mpga`, `.m4a`, `.ogg`, `.wav`, or `.webm`.
expect.name: fileName
expect.label: File Name

expect.help: An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio segment. The prompt should match the audio language.
expect.name: prompt
expect.label: Prompt

expect.help:
Higher temperatures generate more diverse and creative responses. For example, `0.8`. Lower temperatures generate more focused and well-defined responses. For example, `0.2`.
The default value is `1`.
expect.name: temperature
expect.label: Temperature

expect.help: The language code of the input audio in [ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639_language_codes) format. For more information on supported languages, see the [OpenAI Supported languages](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/speech-to-text/supported-languages).
expect.name: language
expect.label: Language

createATranscription.description: Creates a text transcription of an audio.

createAChatCompletion.name: createAChatCompletion
createAChatCompletion.label: Create a Chat Completion (Prompt)

expect.help: For more information about chat completion please follow [OpenAI documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat).
expect.name: messages

nested.help: The contents of the message. This parameter is required except for `Assistant` role with function calls.
nested.name: content
nested.label: Message Content

spec.help: `Image` is supported by only GPT-4 Turbo with Vision model.
spec.name: type
spec.label: Type

nested.help: The contents of the message. This parameter is required except for `Assistant` role with function calls.
nested.name: content
nested.label: Message Content

expect.label: Messages

mappable.help:
◉ The messages(s) to generate chat completions for (in an **Array** ) - e.g. `[{"role": "system", "content": "You are a hellpful assistant."}]`
◉ For more information about chat completion please follow [OpenAI documentation](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/chat).

expect.help: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
expect.name: max_tokens
expect.label: Max Tokens

expect.help:
Higher temperatures generate more diverse and creative responses. For example, `0.8`. Lower temperatures generate more focused and well-defined responses. For example, `0.2`.
The default value is `1`.
expect.name: temperature
expect.label: Temperature

expect.help:
Nucleus sampling considers the results of the tokens with probability mass. Use as an alternative to sampling with temperature.
The default value is `1`.
expect.name: top_p
expect.label: Top P

expect.help: The number of responses to generate. Defaults to `1`.
expect.name: n
expect.label: Number of Completions

expect.help: Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
expect.name: frequency_penalty
expect.label: Frequency Penalty

expect.help: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.
expect.name: presence_penalty
expect.label: Presence Penalty

expect.help: Configuration of the occurrence of specific tokens in the generated response. It is not available with the deployment that contains `GPT-4 Vision` models.
expect.name: logit_bias

spec.help:
Accepts an array of tokens (specified by their token ID in the GPT tokenizer) and probability values. You can use this [tokenizer tool](https://platform.openai.com/tokenizer?view=bpe) (which works for all GPT-2 and GPT-3 and GPT-4) to convert text to token IDs.
The exact effect will vary per model, but values between `-1` and `1` should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like `-100` or `100` should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.
spec.name: probability
spec.label: Probability

expect.label: Token Probability

expect.help: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.
expect.name: stop
expect.label: Stop Sequences

createAChatCompletion.description: Creates a response for the provided chat message(s).

devMakeAnApiCallDontRelease.label: DELETE Make an API Call DON'T RELEASE

azureOpenaiEndpointOptions.name: azureOpenaiEndpointOptions

description: Azure OpenAI is a cloud-based platform that enables developers and data scientists to build and deploy AI models quickly and easily. With Azure OpenAI, users can access a wide range of AI tools and technologies to create intelligent applications, including natural language processing, computer vision, and deep learning.  Azure OpenAI is designed to accelerate the development of AI applications, allowing users to focus on creating innovative solutions that deliver value to their organizations and customers.
